result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy Allen Fritsch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: To any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served, with Huber.

miscConds.notes: *Pay all mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*NO contact with firearms.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
*NO violent contact with victim unless approved by court or agent.

*Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
*Batterers Intervention program.

*AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
*Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: *Time stayed pending review scheduled for 11/20/15 at 1:30pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy Allen Fritsch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roy Allen Fritsch in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant.
AS TO COUNT 2
The court sentenced the defendant to 70 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 DAY time served, with Huber.  Court STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION
-Serve 30 DAYS as Condition Time, STAYED pending review.
-Batterers Intervention program.
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety, random urine screens.
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.
-No VIOLENT contact with victim unless approved by court or agent.
-Obtain/maintain employment.
-No contact with firearms.
-Pay all MANDATORY court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation, failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
-Court WAIVED all NON-Mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges due to inability to pay.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a crime of domestic violence.
*Court advised that to comply with No Contact Order.

Filed: 
-Pretrial Sentence Credit
-Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
-Memorandum of Conditions of Probation

Defendant Roy Allen Fritsch in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter.
AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to Plea Negotiations, on a motion of the state, the court ordered Count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.
AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roy Allen Fritsch in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact orders to a No Violent Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain. Case remains set or Jury Trial in branch 23 on 7/13/2015 at 8:30 AM.

Defendant Roy Allen Fritsch in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for Bail Hearing & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Court advised parties that all discovery must be turned over, all witness lists and motions filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Case adjourned for Bail Hearing & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received & Filed, Notice of Retainer & Cover Letter.
Victim present in court requesting modification of the No Contact order.  State opposes.  Court orders the No Contact order to remain.

Defendant Roy Allen Fritsch in court PRO SE.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Pretrial Conference. Defendant ineligible for Public Defender representation, and advised court he will hire private counsel. Court ordered case set for Status of Counsel. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

15RM006311  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
02-07-2015
$250.00 bail to be returned.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-26-2015 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Roy Allen Fritsch
Current: 8928 W Appleton Ave #8, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 02-09-2015)
Prior: 8928 W Appleton Ave #8, Milwaukee, WI 53225
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Yolanda B. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Roy Allen Fritsch in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 23.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 2/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
